Gets the first date after Christ, 1 January of Year 1 (0001-01-01).

removeTime

public static void removeTime(Calendar cal)
removes time from a calendar. The calendar remains with the same date and time set to 00:00:00.000

Parameters:
cal - calendar object who's time is removed.

removeTime

public static void removeTime(Date date)
removes time from a date. The date remains with the same date and time set to 00:00:00.000

Parameters:
date - Date who's time is removed.

Shows if a date equals 1/1/0001.

dt - date.
Returns:
returns true is date equals 1/1/0001.

Returns:
returns true is date equals 1/1/0001.

difDays

public static int difDays(Calendar fromDate,
                          Calendar toDate)
Gets the time passed between two dates in days. The time is counted in days, months or years, according to the parameter type specified. The first parameter fromDate must be less or equal than the second parameter toDate. Otherwise the method will return 0.

Parameters:
fromDate -
toDate -
Returns:
Returns the time passed from fromDate until toDate

toDate -
Returns:

addDays

public static Date addDays(Date datein,
                           int days)
Adds days to a date. The parameter days can be negative. In this case the result will be a date before the input parameter datein.

Parameters:
datein -
days -
Returns:
result date

addMonths

                             int months)
Adds months to a date. The parameter months can be negative. In this case the result will be a date before the input parameter datein.

Parameters:
datein -
months -
Returns:
result date

addYears

public static Date addYears(Date datein,
                            int years)
Adds years to a date. The parameter years can be negative. In this case the result will be a date before the input parameter datein.

Parameters:
datein -
years -
Returns:
result date as string

getDate

public static Date getDate(Object dt)
                    throws ParseException
Gets a date from the parameter dt. If dt is a date type (Calendar, Timestamp etc) it will be converted to a Date object. Otherwise the result of the objects toString() will be converted to date according to the system locale.

Parameters:
dt - object representing a date.
Returns:
Returns a date for this object.
Throws:
ParseException

formatDate

public static String formatDate(Date dt)
Creates a formatted string from a Date. The formatted string is based on the short date format specified by Bo2UtilsEnvironment.getDfShort().

Parameters:
dt - Date to format.
Returns:
Returns a formatted string for this date.

formatDateIso

public static String formatDateIso(Date dt)
Creates a formatted string from a Date. The formatted string is based on the ISO date format specified by Bo2UtilsEnvironment.getDfIso().

Parameters:
dt - Date to format.
Returns:
Returns a formatted string for this date.

Creates a formatted string from a Date. The formatted string is based on the long date format specified by Bo2UtilsEnvironment.getDfLong().

Parameters:
cal - Date to format.
Returns:
Returns a formatted string for this date.

year

public static final int year(Date date)
Gets the year of the specified date.

Parameters:
date - Date.
Returns:
Returns the year of the specified date.

month

public static final int month(Date date)
Gets the month of the specified date.
The month returned is for display format and not the same as the int values defined on Calendar (i.e. for January this method will return 1 and not 0)

Parameters:
date - Date.
Returns:
Returns the month of the specified date.

days

public static final int days(Date date)
Gets the day of the month of the specified date. The first day of month returns 1.

Parameters:
date - Date.
Returns:
Returns the day of month of the specified date.

daysDifFromEpoch

public static int daysDifFromEpoch(Date date)
Gets the time passed between a date and epoch in days.
Epoch is defined in GregorianCalendar as January 1, 1970. If the date passed as parameter is before epoch then a negative result will be returned.

Parameters:
date - Date.
Returns:
Difference from Date to 'epoch' in days. Negative if Date is before epoch

getDateDDMMYYYY

public static Date getDateDDMMYYYY(String ddmmyyyy)
Parses a String dd/mm/yyyy representation of a date and returns a Date.

Parameters:
ddmmyyyy -
Returns:
a Date instance.

Parameters:

Returns:
true if the given date is part of the standard Greek holidays.
